articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader.
articles.title: Hezbollah targets Israeli troops on Lebanese border, sirens in Beirut

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Leonara LaPeter Anton
articles.description: Hurricane Milton marched across central Florida on Thursday after making landfall on the state's west coast hours earlier, whipping up deadly tornadoes, destroying homes and knocking out power to nearly 2 million customers.
articles.title: Hurricane Milton weakens as it marches across central Florida, homes destroyed

articles.author: Simon Johnson, Justyna Pawlak
articles.description: South Korean author Han Kang won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Literature for "her intense poetic prose that confronts historical traumas and exposes the fragility of human life", the award-giving body said on Thursday.
articles.title: Han Kang of South Korea wins Nobel literature prize 2024

articles.author: Jason Lange, Bo Erickson
articles.description: Harris leads Trump among voters in the vast middle of American society by 47% to 41%.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris overtakes Trump among suburban voters, Reuters/Ipsos polling shows

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: A United Nations inquiry said on Thursday it found that Israel carried out a concerted policy of destroying Gaza's healthcare system in the Gaza war, actions amounting to both war crimes and the crime against humanity of extermination.
articles.title: UN inquiry accuses Israel of crime of 'extermination' in destruction of Gaza health system

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have acted illegally by shooting at positions used by U.N. peacekeepers in Lebanon, Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto said on Thursday, denouncing it as a possible war crime.
articles.title: Angry Italy protests to Israel after shots fired at UN in Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian overnight and early morning attacks on Ukraine hit civilian and critical infrastructure facilities, injuring at least seven people across the country, authorities said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russia hits civilian, critical infrastructure, injures eight in Ukraine

articles.author: Julien Pretot
articles.description: Rafa Nadal will call time on his illustrious but injury-plagued career after next month's Davis Cup Finals, the 22-times Grand Slam champion announced on Thursday, as one of the greatest players in the sport prepares for an emotional farewell.
articles.title: 'King of Clay' Nadal to end stellar career after injury-hit spell

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO will begin its annual nuclear exercise on Monday, alliance Secretary General Mark Rutte said on Thursday, against a backdrop of heightened nuclear rhetoric from Russian President Vladimir Putin.
articles.title: NATO to hold annual nuclear drill from Monday, alliance chief Rutte says

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Parisa Hafezi, Pesha Magid
articles.description: Gulf states are lobbying Washington to stop Israel from attacking Iran's oil sites because they are concerned their own oil facilities could come under fire from Tehran's proxies if the conflict escalates, three Gulf sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Stop Israel from bombing Iran's oil sites, Gulf states urge US
